newsitem.title: USA: Reliance Acceptance sees Q4 loss, year profit.
newsitem.headline: Reliance Acceptance sees Q4 loss, year profit.

text.p: Reliance Acceptance Group Inc, formerly Cole Taylor Financial Group Inc, said Friday it would make "significant" provisions for credit losses for the fourth quarter of 1996 and as a result it expects to report a loss for the fourth quarter.
The company said it expects a profit for all of 1996.
A company spokeswoman declined to say how much would be added to reserves, saying only that the provision would be similar in magnitude to those of other companies in the industry.
A year ago, Reliance made no provisions for loan losses in the fourth quarter.
The spokeswoman declined to give a specific earnings projection.

The company said its fourth quarter earnings, scheduled for release on about February 21, have been delayed largely due to the completion of the split-off transaction of Cole Taylor Bank on February 12.

The split-off transaction leaves Reliance as a stand-alone subprime automobile finance company with equity capital of over $100 million, up from about $30 million before the transaction, and with under 11 million shares outstanding.
